PERSONAL_WEBSITE.name: Personal Website
PERSONAL_WEBSITE.funFact: I taught kids how to make their own websites, before I even made mine.
PERSONAL_WEBSITE.biggestChallenge: Exploring and combining features of Vuetify to create clean creative UI, such as the v-cards and v-hover effect. Navigating through the Vuetify API documentation because it was new territory. Organizing enums, css styles, and components.

KRABBY_PATTY.name: Krabby Patty Flipping Game (unfinished)
KRABBY_PATTY.funFact: Most of the assets, like the game map and the krabby patties, I drew using Adobe Illustrator. I also animated the Squidward sprite in the main menu hardcoding each sprite from the spritesheet.
KRABBY_PATTY.biggestChallenge: Managing and organizing the clicks between a raw patty, a perfect patty, and a burnt patty. For awhile, it was difficult to get the sprite to change its texture after a certain amount of time on the grill.

HOTEL_MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM.name: Hotel Management System
HOTEL_MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM.funFact: A lot of the names used for debugging and testing were from my favorite film, Almost Famous.
HOTEL_MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM.biggestChallenge: Managing and organizing header and cpp files, as this was my first time doing OOP on my own. Also, making the text look somewhat nice on the terminal.

SIMS_MOBILE_APP.name: Sims 4 Cheats Mobile App
SIMS_MOBILE_APP.funFact: I gave up on making this app more than 3 times. I first tried developing it back in 2017, but I got stuck trying to understand Xcode's UI. Four years later, I successfully developed the app in one week.
SIMS_MOBILE_APP.biggestChallenge: Passing data backwards in the Career and Skills cheats scenes to the Bookmark scene. I wanted users to be able to keep their bookmarked cheats; I wanted the app to remember old data.

C_STYLE_BOARD_GAME.name: C-Style Board Game
C_STYLE_BOARD_GAME.funFact: This was a school assignment for my Intro to Programming class. One of the hardest things I ever made because I was new to game logic.
C_STYLE_BOARD_GAME.biggestChallenge: Printing the board. I had a difficult time understanding that you could store the characters for the project inside a 2D array given the correct conditions. Then just print everything once all if statements are passed.
